availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Kenaz Farrow (Montgomery County, Kentucky, judge and farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, judge and farmer. Culpeper County, Virginia, native. Married to Susan French Farrow in Clark County, Kentucky, on January 14, 1814. Father of Edward R. Farrow, Elizabeth B. Farrow, and Stephen F. Farrow. Read law with Samuel Hanson in Clark County in 1812. Served in Captain James Sympson's Company, Kentucky Militia, as a private in the War of 1812 in 1814. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1822 to 1824. Judge of the Eleventh Judicial District of Kentucky from 1838 to 1851. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1857. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
